verses.text: O ye children of Benjamin, gather yourselves to flee out of the midst of Jerusalem, and blow the trumpet in Tekoa, and set up a sign of fire in Beth-haccerem: for evil appeareth out of the north, and great destruction.
I have likened the daughter of Zion to a comely and delicate \add woman\add* .
The shepherds with their flocks shall come to her; they shall pitch \add their\add* tents against her on every side; they shall feed every one in his place.
Prepare ye war against her; arise, and let us go up at noon. Woe to us! for the day departeth, for the shadows of the evening are lengthened.
Arise, and let us go by night, and let us destroy her palaces.
For thus hath the LORD of hosts said, Hew ye down trees, and cast a mount against Jerusalem: this \add is\add* the city to be visited; she \add is\add* wholly oppression in the midst of her.
As a fountain casteth out her waters, so she casteth out her wickedness: violence and devastation is heard in her; before me continually \add are\add* grief and wounds.
Be thou instructed, O Jerusalem, lest my soul depart from thee; lest I make thee desolate, a land not inhabited.
Thus saith the LORD of hosts, They shall thoroughly glean the remnant of Israel as a vine: turn back thy hand as a grape-gatherer into the baskets.

To whom shall I speak, and give warning, that they may hear? Behold, their ear \add is\add* uncircumcised, and they cannot hearken: behold, the word of the LORD is to them a reproach; they have no delight in it.

Therefore I am full of the fury of the LORD; I am weary with holding in: I will pour it out upon the children abroad, and upon the assembly of young men together: for even the husband with the wife shall be taken, the aged with \add him that is\add* full of days.
And their houses shall be turned to others, \add with their\add* fields and wives together: for I will stretch out my hand upon the inhabitants of the land, saith the LORD.
For from the least of them even to the greatest of them every one \add is\add* given to covetousness; and from the prophet even to the priest every one dealeth falsely.
They have healed also the hurt of the daughter of my people slightly, saying, Peace, peace; when \add there is\add* no peace.

Were they ashamed when they had committed abomination? no, they were not at all ashamed, neither could they blush: therefore they shall fall among them that fall: at the time \add that\add* I visit them they shall be cast down, saith the LORD.

Thus saith the LORD, Stand ye in the ways, and see, and ask for the old paths, where \add is\add* the good way, and walk in it, and ye shall find rest for your souls. But they said, We will not walk \add in it\add* .
Also I set watchmen over you, \add saying\add* , Hearken to the sound of the trumpet. But they said, We will not hearken.
Therefore hear, ye nations, and know, O congregation, what \add is\add* among them.
Hear, O earth: behold, I will bring evil upon this people, \add even\add* the fruit of their thoughts, because they have not hearkened to my words, nor to my law, but have rejected it.
To what purpose cometh there to me incense from Sheba, and the sweet cane from a distant country? your burnt-offerings \add are\add* not acceptable, nor your sacrifices sweet to me.
Therefore thus saith the LORD, Behold, I will lay stumbling-blocks before this people, and the fathers and the sons together shall fall upon them; the neighbor and his friend shall perish.
Thus saith the LORD, Behold, a people cometh from the north country, and a great nation shall be raised from the sides of the earth.

They shall lay hold on bow and spear; they \add are\add* cruel, and have no mercy; their voice roareth like the sea; and they ride upon horses, set in array as men for war against thee, O daughter of Zion.
We have heard the fame of it: our hands become feeble: anguish hath taken hold of us, \add and\add* pain, as of a woman in travail.
Go not forth into the field, nor walk by the way; for the sword of the enemy \add and\add* fear \add is\add* on every side.

O daughter of my people, gird \add thee\add* with sackcloth, and wallow thyself in ashes: make thee mourning, \add as for\add* an only son, most bitter lamentation: for the spoiler shall suddenly come upon us.
I have set thee \add for\add* a tower \add and\add* a fortress among my people, that thou mayest know and try their way.
They \add are\add* all grievous revolters, walking with slanders: \add they are\add* brass and iron; they \add are\add* all corrupters.
The bellows is burned, the lead is consumed by the fire; the founder melteth in vain: for the wicked are not plucked away.
Reprobate silver shall \add men\add* call them, because the LORD hath rejected them.
